intro: Neoalsomitra pubigera, commonly known as the hairy neoalsomitra, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often pubescent, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with four to five petals, and are pollinated by insects.
